snippet: Reacting with unusual swiftness, the Vatican on Friday dismissed any suggestion that Pope Francis was implicated in abuses by Argentina’s dictatorship in the 1970s.
abstract: Vatican rejects any suggestion that Pope Francis was implicated in Argentina's so-called Dirty War during 1970s, when nation's military dictatorship tortured, killed or 'disappeared' as many as 30,000 people.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Alan Cowell from London, Nicholas Kulish from Berlin, and Simon Romero and Emily Schmall from Buenos Aires.

lead_paragraph: Reacting with unusual swiftness, the Vatican on Friday dismissed any suggestion that Pope Francis was implicated in abuses by Argentina’s dictatorship in the 1970s.
